sen.j: 天龍寺船（てんりゅうじぶね）は、日本の南北朝時代 (日本)、京都天龍寺造営費捻出のために室町幕府公認の下、元 (王朝)へ派遣された貿易船（寺社造営料唐船）である。
sen.e: Tenryuji-bune refers to official trading vessels of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), dispatched to Yuan Dynasty in order to raise funds to build Tenryu-ji Temple during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

Tenryuji-bune refers to official trading vessels of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), dispatched to Yuan Dynasty in order to raise funds to build Tenryu-ji Temple during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

Tenryuji-bune refers to official trading vessels of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), dispatched to Yuan Dynasty in order to raise funds to build Tenryu-ji Temple during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 当時は「造天龍寺宋船」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was called "Zo Tenryu-ji sosen" in those days.
They were called "Zo Tenryu-ji sosen" in those days.
They were called 'Zo Tenryu-ji sosen' in those days.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 南朝 (日本)の後醍醐天皇は延元4年（1339年、北朝 (日本)では暦応2年）に崩御した。
sen.e: Godaigo, the emperor of the Southern Court (Japan) passed away in 1339.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Godaigo, the emperor of the Southern Court (Japan) passed away in 1339.
The Emperor Godaigo of the Southern Court (Japan) passed away in 1339.

sen.j: 北朝の征夷大将軍足利尊氏は敵味方の立場を超え、菩提を弔うために、夢窓疎石の勧めに従って天龍寺創建を決定した（尊氏が後醍醐天皇の怨霊に悩まされていたともいう）。
sen.e: Regardless of the side, Takauji ASHIKAGA, the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Northern Court decided to erect Tenryu-ji Temple in order to pray to Buddha for the happiness of the deceased emperor at Muso Soseki's suggestion (It is said that Takauji might be afflicted by Emperor Godaigo's vindictive spirit).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Regardless of the side, Takauji ASHIKAGA, the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Northern Court decided to erect Tenryu-ji Temple in order to pray to Buddha for the happiness of the deceased emperor at Muso Soseki's suggestion (It is said that Takauji might be afflicted by Emperor Godaigo's vindictive spirit).

Regardless of the side, Takauji ASHIKAGA, the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Northern Court decided to erect Tenryu-ji Temple in order to pray to Buddha for the happiness of the deceased emperor at Muso Soseki's suggestion (it is said that Takauji might be afflicted by the Emperor Godaigo's vindictive spirit).

sen.j: そこで元々大覚寺統の離宮であった嵯峨野の亀山殿を禅院に改め、夢窓を開山として天龍寺を創建することを決めた。
sen.e: Then, he decided to create a Zen temple from Kameyama-dono Palace, Sagano, which was originally a detached palace of Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama), and found as Tenryu-ji Temple placing Muso as kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Then, he decided to create a Zen temple from Kameyama-dono Palace, Sagano, which was originally a detached palace of Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama), and found as Tenryu-ji Temple placing Muso as kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest).

Then, he decided to change Kameyama-dono Palace, Sagano, which was originally a detached palace of Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama), into a Zen temple and found as Tenryu-ji Temple placing Muso as kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest).

sen.j: また寺領として日向国国富荘などを寄進することを決めた。
sen.e: He also decided to contribute Kudomi-no-sho estate in Hyuga Province etc. as jiryo (estate of temple).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He also decided to contribute Kudomi-no-sho estate in Hyuga Province etc. as jiryo (estate of temple).
He also decided to contribute Kudomi no sho manor in Hyuga Province, and so on as jiryo (estate of temple).

sen.j: また光厳天皇も、丹波国弓削荘を施入している。
sen.e: Moreover, Emperor Kogon also donated Yuge sho, Tanba Province.
Moreover, Emperor Kogon also donated Yuge sho, Tanba Province.
Moreover, Emperor Kogon also donated Yuge no sho manor, Tanba Province.

sen.j: 造営費用には当初、安芸国・周防国両国の公領からの収入をあてる計画であった。
sen.e: In the beginning, the revenue from the Imperial estate of Aki and Suo Province was planned to cover the erection expenses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the beginning, the revenue from the Imperial estate of Aki and Suo Province was planned to cover the construction expenses.
In the beginning, the revenue from the Imperial estate of Aki and Suo Provinces was planned to cover the construction expenses.

sen.j: しかし、成立間もない室町幕府は南朝との戦いにより財政的に逼迫した状況にあり、荘園・公領からの年貢も滞っていた
sen.e: However, newly founded Muromachi bakufu was financially pressed by the battle with the Southern Court, and the land tax from manor and Imperial estate was delayed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the newly founded Muromachi bakufu was financially pressed from conducting the battle with the Southern Court, and the land tax from manor and Imperial estate was delayed.
However, the newly founded Muromachi bakufu was financially pressed from conducting the battle with the Southern Court, and the land tax from manor and Imperial estate was delayed.

sen.j: そのため、巨額の造営費を出すことは困難な状況にあった。
sen.e: Therefore, squeezing a large amount of building expenses was difficult.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, squeezing out a large amount of building expenses was difficult.
Therefore, squeezing out a large amount of building expenses was difficult.

sen.j: 南北朝の動乱による武家・公家・寺社の所領をめぐる利益衝突の融和策として天龍寺建立に賛同した副将軍・足利直義。
sen.e: Vice-Shogun Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA agreed to Tenryu-ji Temple erection as a reconciliation policy of the profit conflict concerning the territory of the samurai class, the court noble, and temples and shrines due to the disturbance of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Vice-Shogun Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA agreed to Tenryu-ji Temple construction as a reconciliation policy of the profit conflict concerning the territory of the samurai class, the court nobles, and temples and shrines due to the disturbance of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.

Vice-Shogun Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA agreed to Tenryu-ji Temple construction as a reconciliation policy of the profit conflict concerning the territory of the samurai class, the court nobles, and temples and shrines due to the disturbance of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.

sen.j: 彼は夢窓と相談し、鎌倉幕府の例にならって、寺社造営料唐船の派遣を検討する。
sen.e: He consulted with Muso and considered sending trading vessels to Yuan in order to raise funds to build the temple, following an example of Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He consulted with Muso and considered sending trading vessels to Yuan in order to raise funds to build the temple, following an example of the Kamakura bakufu.
He consulted with Muso and considered sending trading vessels to Yuan in order to raise funds to build the temple, following an example of the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 朝廷の明経道・明法道博士などの意見も求めたが、幕府・朝廷から様々な反対意見が多かった。
sen.e: He invited comments from Myogyo-do (the study of Confusian classics), Myobodo hakase (teacher of the law in the Ritsuryo system) of Imperial Court, etc.; there were various dissenting opinions from bakufu and Imperial Court.

He invited comments from Myogyo-do (the study of Confusian classics), Myobodo hakase (teacher of the law in the Ritsuryo system) of Imperial Court, etc.; there were various dissenting opinions from the bakufu and Imperial Court.

He invited comments from hakase (teachers) of Myogyodo (the study of Confucian classics) and Myobodo (the study of Codes) of Imperial Court, and so on; there were various dissenting opinions from the bakufu and Imperial Court.

sen.j: また当時、元側でも1335年から1336年にかけての倭寇事件を契機に、寧波市（明州、のちの寧波）に入港する日本船を海賊船と見なして、港の出入を厳しく制限していた。
sen.e: Moreover, in those days, Yuan officials rigorously restricted entry or departure of the port, regarding any Japanese ship, which entered Neiha city (Mingzhou, later Ningbo), as a pirate ship after the Wako Incident from 1335 to 1336.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, in those days, Yuan officials rigorously restricted entry or departure of the port, regarding any Japanese ship, which entered Neiha city (Mingzhou, later Ningbo), as a pirate ship after the Wako Incident from 1335 to 1336.

Moreover, in those days, Yuan officials rigorously restricted entry or departure of the port, regarding any Japanese ship, which entered Neiha city (Mingzhou, later Ningbo), as a pirate ship after the Wako Incident from 1335 to 1336.

sen.j: 日元間の通航は途絶していた。
sen.e: Sailing between Japan and Yuan had been suspended.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Sailing between Japan and Yuan had been suspended.
Sailing between Japan and Yuan had been suspended.

sen.j: しかし度重なる夢窓の懇請を受け、暦応4年12月23日 (旧暦)（1342年1月30日）直義は夢窓に対し、翌年秋に宋船2艘を渡航させ、交易で得られた利益を天龍寺造営にあてるよう提案する。
sen.e: On January 30, 1342, Tadayoshi complied with Muso's repeated earnest request and proposed that two vessels would make a voyage in fall in the following year, and that the profit gained from the trade would cover the expense for erection of Tenryu-ji Temple.

On January 30, 1342, Tadayoshi complied with Muso's repeated earnest request and proposed that two vessels would make a voyage in fall in the following year, and that the profit gained from the trade would cover the expense for constructing Tenryu-ji Temple.

On February 7, 1342, Tadayoshi complied with Muso's repeated earnest request and proposed that two vessels would make a voyage in fall in the following year, and that the profit gained from the trade would cover the expense for constructing Tenryu-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦にしました。

sen.j: そこで夢窓はまず1艘を派遣することとした。
sen.e: Then, Muso decided to dispatch one vessel first.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Then, Muso decided to dispatch one vessel first.
Then, Muso decided to dispatch one vessel first.

sen.j: 彼は博多商人の至本（国籍は不明）を綱司（船長）として推挙した。
sen.e: He recommended Hakata merchant Shihon (his citizenship is unknown) as captain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He recommended Hakata merchant Shihon (his citizenship is unknown) as captain.
He recommended Hakata merchant Shihon (his citizenship is unknown) as captain.

sen.j: 至本は貿易の成否に関わらず、帰国時に現金5000貫文を納めることを約し、予定の通り翌康永元年（1342年）8月に元へ渡航した。
sen.e: Shihon was promised to receive 5000 kanmon (1,000 kanmon = 10,000 yen) on his return regardless of the outcome of trade; he sailed to Yuan in September 1342, as scheduled.
Shihon was promised 5000 kanmon (1,000 kanmon = 10,000 yen) on his return regardless of the outcome of trade; he sailed to Yuan in September 1342, as scheduled.
Shihon was promised 5000 kanmon (approximately 50,000 yen) on his return regardless of the outcome of trade; he sailed to Yuan in September 1342, the following year, as scheduled.

sen.j: 10月に明州に入港した船は、果たして海賊船と見なされた。
sen.e: The vessel arrived in the Mingzhou in November and was regarded as a pirate ship sure enough.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The vessel arrived in the Mingzhou in November and was regarded as a pirate ship sure enough.
The vessel arrived in the Mingzhou in November and was regarded as a pirate ship sure enough.

sen.j: 船は警戒を受けるが、結局上陸を果たし、交易に成功する。
sen.e: Although the vessel was alerted, they were eventually allowed to land and succeeded in trade.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Although the vessel was alerted, they were eventually allowed to land and succeeded in trade.
Although the vessel was alerted, they were eventually allowed to land and succeeded in trade.

sen.j: 日本からの寺社造営料唐船としては元弘2年（1332年）に派遣された住吉大社造営料唐船以来、10年ぶりとなった。
sen.e: It was for the first time in a decade as a trading vessels dispatched to Yuan from Japan in order to raise funds to build a temple or a shrine since Sumiyoshi-taisha shrine zoeiryo tosen (trading vessels dispatched to T'ang-Dynasty in order to raise funds to construct Sumiyoshi-taisha shrine), which was dispatched in 1332.

It was for the first time in a decade as a trading vessels dispatched to Yuan from Japan in order to raise funds to build a temple or a shrine since Sumiyoshi-taisha shrine zoeiryo tosen (trading vessels dispatched to T'ang-Dynasty in order to raise funds to construct Sumiyoshi-taisha shrine), which was dispatched in 1332.

It was for the first time in a decade as a trading vessels dispatched to Yuan from Japan in order to raise funds to build a temple or a shrine since Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine zoeiryo tosen (trading vessels dispatched to Tang-Dynasty in order to raise funds to construct Sumiyoshi-taisha shrine), which was dispatched in 1332.

sen.j: またこの頃、日元間で禅僧の交流が盛んであった。
sen.e: Moreover, interaction between Japanese and Yuan Zen monks flourished these days.
Moreover, interaction between Japanese and Yuan Zen monks flourished in those days.
Moreover, interaction between Japanese and Yuan Zen monks flourished in those days.

sen.j: これ以前に来日した明極楚俊・竺仙梵僊。
sen.e: Minki Soshuns, Jikusen Bonsens, et al. had visited Japan previously.
Minki Soshuns, Jikusen Bonsens, et al. had visited Japan previously.
Minki Soshuns, Jikusen Bonsens, and so on had visited Japan previously.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 彼らの薫陶を受けた禅僧たちが留学を志望した。
sen.e: The Zen monks who were disciplined by them aspired to study in Yuan.
The Zen monks who were disciplined by them aspired to study in Yuan.
The Zen monks who were disciplined by them aspired to study in Yuan.

sen.j: 天龍寺船にも性海霊見・雲夢裔沢・南海宝洲・天然興雲・愚中周及など約60名の禅僧が乗船した。
sen.e: Approximately 60 Zen monks, including Shokai Reiken, 雲夢裔沢, 南海宝洲, 天然興雲, and Guchu Shukyu, boarded the Tenryuji-bune.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。雲夢裔沢、南海宝洲、天然興雲 読み不明
sen.e: Approximately 60 Zen monks, including Shokai Reiken, 雲夢裔沢, 南海宝洲, 天然興雲, and Guchu Shukyu, boarded the Tenryuji-bune.
Approximately 60 Zen monks, including Shokai Reiken, Unbo Eitaku (雲夢裔沢), Nankai Hoshu (南海宝洲), Tennen Koun (天然興雲), and Guchu Shukyu, boarded the Tenryuji-bune.
sen.cmt: 想定できる読みを補足しました。

sen.j: しかし多くは元の官憲に阻まれ、入明を果たしたのは愚中ら11人のみだったという。
sen.e: However, many were hindered by the constituted authorities of Yuan, and it is said that only 11 of them, including Guchu, could enter Mingzhou.
However, many were hindered by the constituted authorities of Yuan, and it is said that only 11 of them, including Guchu, could enter Mingzhou.
However, many were hindered by the constituted authorities of Yuan, and it is said that only 11 of them, including Guchu, could enter Mingzhou.

sen.j: 天龍寺船は莫大な利益を上げて帰国。
sen.e: Tenryuji-bune returned to Japan having made an immense profit.
Tenryuji-bune returned to Japan having made an immense profit.
Tenryuji-bune returned to Japan having made an immense profit.

sen.j: このときの利益を元に天龍寺の建設が進められ、康永2年（1343年）11月に竣工。
sen.e: Construction of Tenryu-ji Temple was started with the profit of the trade, and it was completed in November (lunar calendar), 1343.
Construction of Tenryu-ji Temple was started with the profits of the trade, and it was completed in November (lunar calendar), 1343.
Construction of Tenryu-ji Temple was started with the profits of the trade, and it was completed in November, 1343.

sen.j: 貞和元年8月29日 (旧暦)（1345年9月25日）には、後醍醐天皇七回忌にあわせて落慶供養を迎えた。
sen.e: The dedication ceremony was held on September 25, 1345 in accordance with the Emperor Godaigo's 6th anniversary of death.
The dedication ceremony was held on September 25, 1345 in accordance with the Emperor Godaigo's sixth anniversary of his death.
The dedication ceremony was held on October 3, 1345 in accordance with the Emperor Godaigo's sixth anniversary of his death.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。
